metadata.dc:title: Exposures to electronic cigarettes: calls to the poison center in Spain
metadata.dc:creator: Conejo Menor, José Luis
Oliva Urieta, Susana de la
metadata.dc:description: Introduction. Electronic cigarettes (EC) have gained great popularity. The goal is describe calls received by an exposure to EC in Spanish poison center. Material and methods. Calls regarding cases of an exposure to EC between January 1, 2013 and April 30, 2014. Information was obtained from the database of the Spanish poison center (Servicio de Información Toxicológica). Results. 64 cases in which the product involved was a CE were recorded, an increase of 3 to 23 cases in the last quarter of 2013 was observed. Two thirds of the cases registered were ingestion of liquid containing the refillable cartridge, 28,1% were children (77.7% under 2 years old). Conclusion. There has been a rapid increase in calls for exposures to EC, which requires monitoring the phenomenon and work closely with health authorities (AU)
metadata.dc:title: Exposiciones a cigarrillos electrónicos: consultas telefónicas al centro antitóxico en España
